DOCNAME: CASE OF KALLIS AND ANDROULLA PANAYI v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are a married couple .
CARDINAL . The parties disagree as to the facts of the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , the applicants ' son , who at that time was DATE , was serving in ORG as a private soldier . TIME he entered ORG ( ORG ) buffer zone in GPE . CARDINAL . The applicants produced a report from the ORG Secretary - General dated DATE . In so far as relevant , this document reads as follows :

“ The third incident took place on DATE . An unarmed ORG soldier was shot and killed inside the ORG buffer zone in central GPE . The investigation has revealed that the lethal round was fired by a NORP - Cypriot soldier whom ORG had observed entering the buffer zone with his rifle strung across his back . Shortly thereafter a single shot was heard and the NORP - Cypriot soldier was seen running back in a crouched position to the NORP ceasefire line holding his rifle in his right hand . UNFICYP soldiers were prevented from reaching the ORG soldier by NORP - Cypriot soldiers who fired shots in the direction of the ORG soldiers each time the latter tried to move forward . CARDINAL . The applicants ' lawyer requested a copy of the relevant reports from ORG . However , his request was refused as the documents in question were considered to be internal ORG documents .
CARDINAL . According to the ORG , the chain of events which led to the death of ORG Panayi could be summarised as follows .

CARDINAL . The incident took place in a part of GPE where LOC marked the boundary of the “ GPE ” ( the “ LOC ” ) . In the NORP part of the buffer zone were the ORG sentry post and the positions of the NORP - Cypriot security forces . The positions of the NORP - Cypriot army ( ORG ) were on the NORP - Cypriot administration 's defence line , QUANTITY west of the ORG patrol road . The UN-CARDINAL observation post was QUANTITY south of the sentry positions of each of the CARDINAL sides . The Yıldırım sentry post was located on high ground which ran down steeply to the river bed ; the latter was marshland , covered with high reeds ; on the NORP - Cypriot side there were huge eucalyptus trees .

CARDINAL . The ORG patrol road was on the other side of the river and entry into “ TRNC ” territory by UNFICYP soldiers was possible only by crossing a wooden bridge . The area starting QUANTITY west of the Yıldırım sentry post in the direction of the NORP - Cypriot sentry post could not be observed from the ORG observation post building , which had a view over the NORP and NORP - Cypriot positions but not the area in between .

CARDINAL . On DATE of the incident it was observed from the Yıldırım sentry post that a fully armed soldier of ORG , who was wearing army uniform , had come out of his duty station and had entered the buffer zone . He made gestures by hand and called to the NORP - Cypriot soldiers on sentry duty to go over to him . One of the NORP - Cypriot soldiers on duty warned him in a loud voice in LANGUAGE , LANGUAGE and NORP not to approach ; another NORP - Cypriot soldier asked the NORP - NORP patrol to come to the area . Ignoring the verbal warning , PERSON proceeded into the buffer zone and descended towards the river bed ; a NORP - Cypriot soldier came out of his sentry post and walked QUANTITY in a westerly direction in order to be able to observe the ORG soldier advancing . At this moment another NORP - Cypriot soldier took up position on the southern side of the communication trench ; a soldier was also located above the trench at a point where he could have a better view of the vicinity of the river . He shouted once more to the NORP - Cypriot soldier , using the NORP word “ PERSON ( “ No ” ) , and instructed him to leave the area .

CARDINAL . In spite of this Stelios Kalli Panayi entered into “ GPE ” territory by crossing the wooden bridge which only ORG soldiers were allowed to use . CARDINAL warning shots were fired by a NORP - Cypriot soldier ( one into the air and one towards the ground ) ; as PERSON proceeded further into “ NORP ” territory , causing a serious threat to the lives of the NORP - Cypriot soldiers , one more shot was fired to stop him .

CARDINAL . On hearing the gunshots , a ORG soldier came out of his observation post , located QUANTITY south of the scene of the incident and started to look around ; as he did not have a clear overall view , he proceeded towards the place where the gunshots had been heard and was about to cross the bridge . However , he was warned by means of QUANTITY shots fired into the air by the NORP soldiers not to advance any further . In fact , the situation was still critical as it was not known whether PERSON had adopted a more advantageous crawling position .

CARDINAL . At TIME an ambulance arrived in the area by the ORG patrol road . ORG Panayi was placed in the ambulance , which left for the hospital . Later , the NORP - Cypriot authorities were informed that he had died .

CARDINAL . The Government drew the attention of ORG to ORG on ORG ( hereinafter “ ORG ) , adopted on DATE at the Eighth ORG on ORG . The relevant provisions of this document read as follows :
“ Whenever the lawful use of force and firearms is unavoidable , law enforcement officials shall :
( a ) Exercise restraint in such use and act in proportion to the seriousness of the offence and the legitimate objective to be achieved ;
( b ) Minimize damage and injury , and respect and preserve human life ;
( c ) Ensure that assistance and medical aid are rendered to any injured or affected persons at the earliest possible moment ;
( d ) Ensure that relatives or close friends of the injured or affected person are notified at the earliest possible moment . ”
“ Governments shall ensure that arbitrary or abusive use of force and firearms by law enforcement officials is punished as a criminal offence under their law . ”

“ Law enforcement officials shall not use firearms against persons except in self - defence or defence of others against the imminent threat of death or serious injury , to prevent the perpetration of a particularly serious crime involving grave threat to life , to arrest a person presenting such a danger and resisting their authority , or to prevent his or her escape , and only when less extreme means are insufficient to achieve these objectives . In any event , intentional lethal use of firearms may only be made when strictly unavoidable in order to protect life . ”

“ In the circumstances provided for under principle CARDINAL , law enforcement officials shall identify themselves as such and give a clear warning of their intent to use firearms , with sufficient time for the warning to be observed , unless to do so would unduly place the law enforcement officials at risk or would create a risk of death or serious harm to other persons , or would be clearly inappropriate or pointless in the circumstances of the incident . ”
“ Rules and regulations on the use of firearms by law enforcement officials should include guidelines that :
( a ) Specify the circumstances under which law enforcement officials are authorized to carry firearms and prescribe the types of firearms and ammunition permitted ;
( b ) Ensure that firearms are used only in appropriate circumstances and in a manner likely to decrease the risk of unnecessary harm ;
( c ) Prohibit the use of those firearms and ammunition that cause unwarranted injury or present an unwarranted risk ;
( d ) Regulate the control , storage and issuing of firearms , including procedures for ensuring that law enforcement officials are accountable for the firearms and ammunition issued to them ;
( e ) Provide for warnings to be given , if appropriate , when firearms are to be discharged ;
( f ) Provide for a system of reporting whenever law enforcement officials use firearms in the performance of their duty . ”
